description: Percent change in real disposable income per capita from Q2 in the year prior to Q2 in the year of the election.
source: From ﻿Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED), series ID A939RX0Q048SBEA. Accessed using the fredr package in R. Original variable is in seasonally adjusted chained 2012 dollars.

description: Percent change in GDP per capita from Q2 in the year prior to Q2 in the year of the election.
source: From ﻿Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED), series ID A229RX0Q048SBEA. Accessed using the fredr package in R. Original variable is in seasonally adjusted chained 2012 dollars.

description: Seasonally adjusted unemployment rate for June in the year of the election.
source: From ﻿Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED), series ID UNRATE. Accessed using the fredr package in R.

description: Difference between the incumbent party's percent of the two-party votes and the challenger's percent
source: Data from Dave Leip at https://uselectionatlas.org/RESULTS/. Data imported from https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Am1cZb9qJXjupfDxVDS0dmhGXb6RgNYONV14NOr8C3E/edit?usp=sharing published to web as a spreadsheet.

description: Name of the candidate that received the most votes
Name of the candidate from the incumbent pary. Not necessily the current president.
Name of the candidate from the non-incumbent party.
